GuidePage.title: Allergen Management Guide
GuidePage.description: Essential tips, guides, and information on how you can manage allergens in your restaurant, prevent cross-contamination, and provide safe dining options for customers with food allergies.

tips.title: Train Staff on Allergen Awareness
tips.content: Ensure all staff members are trained to recognize and handle food allergens. Educate them on the common allergens, how to check ingredient labels, and the importance of preventing cross-contamination.

tips.title: Clear Communication with Customers
tips.content: Encourage customers to inform your staff about their allergies. Make sure your team asks follow-up questions and provides accurate information about ingredients used in each dish.

tips.title: Create an Allergen-Friendly Menu
tips.content: Offer a separate allergen-friendly menu or clearly mark dishes that are free from common allergens like gluten, nuts, or dairy. This makes it easier for customers with allergies to find safe options. Guardos helps you to create a personalized menu for your customers with clear indication of included allergens.

tips.title: Avoid Cross-Contamination in the Kitchen
tips.content: Dedicate separate areas, utensils, and cookware for preparing allergen-free meals. Make sure surfaces are cleaned thoroughly before preparing allergen-free dishes to avoid cross-contact.

tips.title: Label Ingredients Clearly
tips.content: Ensure that all food and ingredients in your kitchen are properly labeled with potential allergens. This helps kitchen staff avoid mistakes and ensures that allergens are properly identified.

GuidePage.preventionDescription: Learn how to prevent allergen exposure and create a safe dining environment for customers with food allergies.

prevention.title: Use Dedicated Equipment for Allergen-Free Dishes
prevention.content: Have separate cutting boards, utensils, and cookware for allergen-free meal preparation. This reduces the risk of cross-contamination.

prevention.title: Allergen-Free Preparation Zones
prevention.content: Designate specific areas in the kitchen for preparing allergen-free meals. Ensure that these areas are cleaned regularly and used exclusively for allergen-free preparation.

prevention.title: Proper Cleaning Procedures
prevention.content: Regularly sanitize all work surfaces, utensils, and cooking equipment. Use different color-coded tools to differentiate between allergen-free and regular meal preparation.

prevention.title: Regular Staff Training
prevention.content: Conduct regular training for staff members on how to handle allergens, respond to customer queries about allergens, and prevent cross-contamination.

prevention.title: Accurate Allergen Information for Customers
prevention.content: Make sure the menu is updated regularly with accurate allergen information. Inform customers about any changes in ingredients that might affect allergen content.

faq.title: What are the most common allergens restaurants should be aware of?
faq.content: The most common food allergens include milk, eggs, peanuts, tree nuts, fish, shellfish, soy, wheat, and sesame. Ensure these allergens are clearly marked on your menu.

faq.title: How can we prevent cross-contamination in the kitchen?
faq.content: To prevent cross-contamination, use separate utensils, cookware, and preparation areas for allergen-free meals. Clean all surfaces thoroughly and make sure staff wash their hands between handling different foods.

faq.title: How should we communicate allergen information to customers?
faq.content: Make sure allergen information is clearly listed on the menu or on a separate allergen menu. Train staff to ask customers about any food allergies and to provide clear, accurate information about ingredients and preparation methods.

faq.title: What steps should be taken if a customer has an allergic reaction in the restaurant?
faq.content: Ensure all staff know how to recognize signs of an allergic reaction and are trained in emergency response procedures. Call emergency services immediately if a customer is experiencing a severe reaction, such as anaphylaxis.

faq.title: How can we keep up with changing allergen information?
faq.content: Regularly update your menu and ingredient lists to reflect any changes in allergen content. Work closely with suppliers to ensure you have accurate and up-to-date information about the ingredients you use.

faq.title: What are the legal requirements for allergen labeling in restaurants?
faq.content: In many countries, restaurants are required by law to provide allergen information to customers. Make sure you comply with all relevant regulations and clearly label allergens on your menu.

faq.title: How often should staff receive allergen training?
faq.content: Staff should receive allergen training at least once a year, or whenever there are significant changes to the menu or food preparation methods. Refresher training is also recommended to ensure ongoing awareness.

faq.title: What should be done if an ingredient's allergen status changes?
faq.content: If an ingredient's allergen status changes, update your menu immediately and inform your staff. Communicate the change clearly to customers, especially those who may have previously ordered the dish.

Privacy.title: Privacy Statement
Privacy.intro: This Privacy Statement explains how Guardos.eu ("Guardos," "we," "us," or "our") collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you interact with our platforms and services. We are committed to ensuring the privacy and security of your personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable data protection laws.
Privacy.controllertxt: Guardos.eu, operated by Guardos, is the data controller responsible for the processing of your personal data. If you have any questions or concerns regarding the processing of your personal information or this Privacy Statement, you can contact us using the contact details provided at the end of this statement.
Privacy.types: 2. Types of Personal Data We Collect
Privacy.typestxt: We collect and process various types of personal data for different purposes:
Privacy.type1txt: When you create an account on Guardos.eu, we collect your email address, username, and password. Additionally, we may ask for your preferred language, allergens, favorite restaurant, and favorite dishes to personalize your experience on our platform.
Privacy.type2txt: If you fill out a contact form on our website, we may collect your name and email address to respond to your inquiries or comments.
Privacy.type3txt: For payment transactions, we may collect payment details such as credit card information. However, we do not store this information directly on our servers. We utilize third-party payment processors who handle this data securely.
Privacy.type4txt: When you create an account, your password is securely encrypted before transmission and stored in our database. Guardos does not have access to or store plaintext passwords. We employ robust security measures to protect your password and ensure the integrity of your account.
Privacy.purposetxt: We process your personal data for the following purposes:
Privacy.purpose1txt: To manage your account and provide personalized services based on your preferences.
Privacy.purpose2txt: To respond to your inquiries, provide assistance, and address any issues or concerns you may have.
Privacy.purpose3txt: To facilitate payment transactions for orders placed on Guardos.eu.
Privacy.purpose4txt: To analyze user behavior and feedback in order to improve our platform, products, and services.
Privacy.legaltxt: The legal bases for processing your personal data may include:
Privacy.legal1txt: Processing is necessary for the performance of a contract with you (e.g., to provide the services you requested).
Privacy.legal2txt: Processing is based on your consent, which you may withdraw at any time.
Privacy.legal3txt: Processing is necessary for our legitimate interests, such as fraud prevention, security, and improving our services.
Privacy.datatxt: Guardos implements appropriate technical and organizational measures to safeguard your personal data against unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. These measures include encryption, access controls, and regular security assessments.
Privacy.sharingtxt: We do not sell or rent your personal information to third parties for marketing purposes. However, we may share your information with trusted third-party service providers who assist us in operating our website, conducting business, or servicing you. These third parties are contractually obligated to use your personal data only as necessary to provide the services requested by Guardos and to protect your information.
Privacy.rightstxt: You have certain rights regarding your personal data, including:
Privacy.right1txt: You have the right to access the personal data we hold about you.
Privacy.right2txt: You have the right to request correction of inaccurate or incomplete personal data.
Privacy.right3txt: You have the right to request deletion of your personal data under certain circumstances.
Privacy.right4txt: You have the right to request restriction of processing of your personal data under certain circumstances.
Privacy.right5txt: You have the right to receive your personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format.
Privacy.right6txt: You have the right to object to processing of your personal data under certain circumstances, including processing for direct marketing purposes.
Privacy.right7txt: If processing is based on your consent, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
Privacy.rightend: To exercise your rights or for any inquiries regarding your personal data, please contact us using the contact information provided at the end of this statement.
Privacy.updatestxt: Guardos may update this Privacy Statement from time to time to reflect changes in our privacy practices or legal requirements. We encourage you to review this statement periodically for the latest information.
Privacy.contacttxt: If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Statement or our privacy practices, please contact us at:
Privacy.end: Thank you for entrusting Guardos.eu with your personal information.

CookieStatement.title: Cookie Statement
CookieStatement.WhyTech: Why do we use these Technologies?
CookieStatement.Security: 1. Security of your data by us and by third parties
CookieStatement.RightInspect: 2. Right to inspect, correct or delete your data
CookieStatement.intro: Guardos.eu employs various technologies such as cookies, trackers and scripts (hereinafter collectively referred to as 'Technologies') across its websites and applications to enhance user experience in terms of speed, security, and overall performance. These Technologies are implemented not only directly by Guardos.eu but also through third-party services engaged by Guardos.eu. Ensuring your privacy concerning these Technologies is of paramount importance to us. For detailed insights into how we handle your data, please consult our
CookieStatement.intro2: Through this cookie statement, we aim to elucidate the nature and purpose of the Technologies we utilize. Should you have any inquiries regarding our use of Technologies or concerns about your privacy in relation to these Technologies, feel free to reach out to us at guardos-help@outlook.com.
CookieStatement.intro3: Upon your initial visit to our websites and applications from any device (such as a computer, smartphone, or tablet), you will encounter our cookie banner. Here, you have the option to either accept all cookies or customize your cookie settings. You retain the flexibility to adjust your cookie preferences at any time through the preferences center (provided below). Nonetheless, please be aware that disabling certain types of cookies may impact your browsing experience on our websites and applications, as well as the range of services we can offer. Rest assured, we always set cookies to remember your preferences and other essential technical cookies.
CookieStatement.cookies: We only store essential cookies, including those with limited analytical functionality, on your device if they are crucial for the proper operation of our services. However, for all other categories of cookies, we seek your explicit consent based on their respective purposes and functions. It's important to note that certain cookies may be placed by third-party services featured on our pages. For a comprehensive understanding of all the technologies we employ, along with their purposes, functions, and lifespan, please refer to our regularly updated
CookieStatement.cookies2: This ensures that you have an accurate overview of the technologies utilized by us.
CookieStatement.introTech: As previously stated, Guardos.eu employs various Technologies for data collection. The Technologies utilized by Guardos.eu include scripts, trackers, and cookies. Below, we will provide an explanation of each Technology:
CookieStatement.script: A script is a segment of programming code designed to facilitate the proper functioning and interactivity of our website. This code may be executed either on our server or directly on your device. Its primary purpose is to ensure seamless operation and enhance user engagement by enabling interactive features and dynamic content presentation.
CookieStatement.tracker: A tracker is an inconspicuous element, often a tiny snippet of text or an image embedded within our website, utilized to monitor and analyze website traffic. To effectively map traffic patterns, we employ multiple trackers, each designed to capture various types of data about user interactions. Additionally, third-party entities may be authorized to install trackers on our website to assist in monitoring and analyzing traffic on our behalf. These trackers play a crucial role in providing valuable insights into user behavior and optimizing our website's performance and user experience.
CookieStatement.cookie: A cookie is a basic, compact text file that is transmitted from certain pages of our website and subsequently stored by your web browser on your computer's hard drive. While some cookies serve to establish connections between your activities on our website during your visit, others persist on your computer's hard drive and are relayed back to our servers, or those of third parties who have deployed the cookie on our behalf, when you revisit our website. This enables us to recognize your device and tailor your browsing experience accordingly, whether it involves remembering your preferences or providing personalized content.
CookieStatement.purposeTech: We deploy cookies, trackers, and scripts for distinct purposes: functional, analytical, and marketing objectives. Here's an outline of the various purposes for employing these Technologies. For a detailed breakdown of all the Technologies we employ, their intended purposes, and specific functionalities, please consult our technologies list. This list undergoes regular updates to furnish you with a precise overview of the Technologies we utilize.
CookieStatement.functional1: We employ various Technologies to ensure the seamless functionality and user-friendliness of our website. Among these, scripts and cookies play vital roles. Scripts enable interactivity on the website, ensuring that actions such as clicking on elements yield the expected outcomes. Cookies, on the other hand, facilitate essential functions like maintaining the shopping basket and remembering selected products or user addresses. Without cookies, these functions would be impractical.
CookieStatement.functional2: Certain Technologies used for functional purposes are indispensable to the website's operation and cannot be disabled. These Technologies are retained for a limited duration, typically not exceeding a few hours after your visit to the website. This ensures that critical functionalities remain intact and accessible during your browsing session.
CookieStatement.analytical: We utilize cookies and trackers to analyze your behavior on our website, aiming to enhance and tailor it according to your preferences. By scrutinizing this data, we endeavor to optimize the user-friendliness of our website. For instance, we monitor which pages are most frequently visited and observe how you navigate through our website. This analytical approach enables us to make informed adjustments and improvements, ultimately striving to provide you with the best possible browsing experience.
CookieStatement.marketing: Obviously we hope that you use our website as often as possible and therefore we use cookies and trackers to advertise our website to you. By means of cookies we can offer interesting offers and / or discounts for you. For this purpose we analyze, among other things, how often you use our website and which products you find interesting. This allows us to better adapt our offer and advertisements to your wishes. Another marketing goal for which we use trackers is to check whether you come from a website of one of our advertisers. This is necessary because we have to pay our advertisers for the customers who visit our website via their platform (or places an order on our platform).
CookieStatement.security: 1. Security of your data by Guardos.eu
CookieStatement.securityTxt: Guardos.eu prioritizes the safeguarding of your data and implements suitable measures to prevent its misuse, loss, unauthorized access, inadvertent disclosure, and unauthorized alteration. If you suspect that your data is not adequately secured or if there are any signs of misuse, please do not hesitate to contact us at: guardos-help@outlook.com. Your concerns will be addressed promptly and thoroughly as we are committed to ensuring the security and integrity of your information.
CookieStatement.securityThirdParty: As mentioned earlier, we incorporate third-party Technologies to aid us in fulfilling the stated objectives. These third-party entities contribute to achieving the purposes outlined in this statement. We strictly prohibit third parties from utilizing your data for their own purposes or for purposes that deviate from those described in this statement. Guardos.eu enters into processing agreements with third-party entities responsible for deploying Technologies on our website on our behalf. These processing agreements are established to uphold the same standards of security and confidentiality for your data. We maintain accountability for the processing of your personal data by third parties acting on behalf of Guardos.eu. Rest assured, we remain committed to safeguarding your privacy and ensuring the integrity of your data throughout its processing lifecycle.
CookieStatement.enableDisable1: You have the flexibility to modify your preferences regarding the Technologies utilized on our website, commonly referred to as cookies across the internet. Additionally, you have the option to delete cookies that have already been placed on your device, as cookies are the only Technology that stores data locally.
CookieStatement.enableDisable2: However, please note that disabling certain Technologies may result in certain parts of our website no longer functioning properly. It's important to understand that essential Technologies necessary for the operation of the website, which may include some scripts and cookies, cannot be deactivated.
CookieStatement.enableDisable3: To assist you in adjusting your settings and potentially deleting cookies, we provide links below that guide you through the process for each browser:
CookieStatement.inspect: You retain the right to request access to, correction, or deletion of your data. For detailed information regarding this process, please refer to our
CookieStatement.inspect2: . To prevent misuse, we may request proper identification from you when handling such requests. This measure ensures the security and integrity of your data throughout the process. We are committed to facilitating your rights regarding your personal data in a transparent and responsible manner.
CookieStatement.tips: For comprehensive details regarding our privacy policy and the processing of your personal data, we encourage you to consult our
CookieStatement.tips2: . Should you have any inquiries or concerns regarding our cookie policy, we are more than willing to assist you. Your satisfaction and understanding are paramount to us, and we are committed to addressing any questions or complaints you may have regarding our policies. Please feel free to reach out to us for assistance.
CookieStatement.conclusion1: We may periodically update this cookie statement in response to evolving legal, technical, or business developments. We reserve the right to modify the content of the cookie statement and the cookies listed in the technology list as necessary. Any changes made to the cookie statement will be effective upon posting.
CookieStatement.conclusion2: If you do not agree with the revised statement, you have the option to adjust your preferences or discontinue using our websites and applications. By continuing to access or utilize our services after the changes take effect, you indicate your acceptance of the revised cookie statement.
CookieStatement.conclusion3: If you have any further questions or comments, please don't hesitate to contact us via guardos-help@outlook.com or through our privacy form.
CookieStatement.conclusion4: We encourage you to check back periodically for the latest updates. Previous versions of our cookie statement will be archived for your reference.
CookieStatement.conclusion5: This cookie statement is subject to modification and was last updated on 08/04/2024.

T&C.title: Guardos Terms and Conditions for Restaurants
T&C.introTxt: Welcome to Guardos! These Terms and Conditions ("Terms") govern your use of our website and mobile application (collectively, the "Service") as a restaurant owner. By accessing or using Guardos, you agree to comply with and be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree with these Terms, you may not use our Service.
T&C.service: "Service" refers to the Guardos website and mobile application.
T&C.user: "User" refers to any individual or entity who accesses or uses the Service, including restaurant owners.
T&C.profile: "Restaurant Profile" refers to the account created on Guardos for listing and managing restaurant information.
T&C.content: "Content" refers to all information, text, graphics, photos, and other materials provided through the Service.
T&C.premium: "Premium Service" refers to the subscription-based service offered by Guardos.
T&C.regTxt: To use certain features of the Service, you must create a Restaurant Profile by providing accurate and complete information about your restaurant. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account and password and for restricting access to your account.
T&C.addTxt: You may add and manage information about your restaurant, including but not limited to:
T&C.allergens: Allergen information, which will be declared automatically based on the ingredients provided.
T&C.paymentTxt: You can add and manage payment methods through Stripe. By using Stripe, you agree to comply with Stripe's terms and conditions.
T&C.conductOpt1: Use the Service for any unlawful purpose or in any way that violates these Terms.
T&C.conductOpt2: Upload or transmit any content that infringes any patent, trademark, trade secret, copyright, or other proprietary rights.
T&C.conductOpt3: Engage in any behavior that could harm or disrupt the Service or interfere with other users' enjoyment of the Service.
T&C.uploadTxt: By uploading or submitting any content to Guardos, you grant us a non-exclusive, royalty-free, perpetual, and worldwide license to use, modify, display, and distribute such content in connection with the Service.
T&C.ownershipTxt: All content and materials on the Service, including text, graphics, logos, and images, are the property of Guardos or its licensors and are protected by copyright and other intellectual property laws.
T&C.licenseTxt: Guardos grants you a limited, non-transferable, and revocable license to access and use the Service for your business purposes.
T&C.restrictionTxt: You may not reproduce, distribute, modify, or create derivative works from any content or materials on the Service without our prior written consent.
T&C.privacyTxt: Your privacy is important to us. Please refer to our Privacy Policy for information on how we collect, use, and protect your personal and business data.
T&C.availabilityTxt: Guardos does not guarantee that the Service will be available at all times or that it will be free from errors or interruptions.
T&C.thirdPartyTxt: The Service may contain links to third-party websites or services. Guardos is not responsible for the content, accuracy, or practices of these third-party sites.
T&C.warrantyTxt: The Service is provided "as is" and "as available," without any warranties of any kind, either express or implied. Guardos disclaims all warranties, including but not limited to the accuracy, reliability, and completeness of the Service.
T&C.limitTxt: In no event shall Guardos be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, or any loss of profits or revenues, whether incurred directly or indirectly, or any loss of data, use, goodwill, or other intangible losses resulting from (a) your use of the Service; (b) any unauthorized access to or use of our servers and/or any personal information stored therein.
T&C.rightTxt: Guardos reserves the right to terminate or suspend your account at any time, without notice, for conduct that it believes violates these Terms or is harmful to other users of the Service.
T&C.effectTxt: Upon termination, your right to use the Service will immediately cease. All provisions of these Terms which by their nature should survive termination shall survive termination, including, without limitation, ownership provisions, warranty disclaimers, and limitations of liability.
T&C.jurisdictionTxt: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Federal Republic of Germany. Any disputes arising out of or relating to these Terms or the use of the Service shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in Berlin, Germany.
T&C.disputeTxt: Any disputes arising out of or relating to these Terms or the use of the Service shall be resolved through binding arbitration in Berlin, Germany, as per the rules of the German Arbitration Institute (DIS).
T&C.contactTxt: If you have any questions or concerns about these Terms, please contact us at:
T&C.name: Guardos
T&C.purchaseTxt: Restaurant owners may purchase additional features or services within the app. All purchases are final and non-refundable, except as required by law.
T&C.appTermsTxt: Your use of the app is also subject to the terms and conditions of the platform from which you downloaded the app (e.g., Apple App Store, Google Play Store).
T&C.deviceTxt: The app may request access to certain features on your device (e.g., location services, camera) to provide the Service. You can manage these permissions through your device settings.
T&C.updateTxt: Guardos reserves the right to update or modify these Terms at any time without prior notice. Your continued use of the Service after any changes constitutes your acceptance of the new Terms. It is your responsibility to review these Terms periodically for any updates or changes.
